stations.name: Partick
stations.description: Partick subway station is one of the largest stations on the Glasgow Subway network. Along with the adjacent bus station, it forms one of the main transport hubs in Glasgow. As of 2022, it is the fifth-busiest station in Scotland.

stations.name: Govan
stations.description: Goven station is located on the south side of the River Clyde. Just to the south of the station is the main depot and test track for the Glasgow Subway. The station is located near the historic Govan Old Parish Church.

stations.name: Ibrox
stations.description: Ibrox station was known as Copland Road until 1977. Nearby is Ibrox Stadium, home of Rangers F.C. The station is extremely busy on matchdays, with an additional entrance on Woodville Street opening to accommodate the vastly increased volume of passenger traffic.

stations.name: Cessnock
stations.description: Cessnock station serves the eastern part of Ibrox and the Cessnock area of the city. It is also the nearest station to Festival Park.

stations.name: Kinning Park
stations.description: Kinning Park subway station serves the Kinning Park area. To reach Kinning Park, a footbridge is provided across the M8. This is the shallowest in the Subway system.

stations.name: Shields Road
stations.description: This station serves the Pollokshields and Kingston areas of Glasgow. Nearby is Charles Rennie Mackintosh's Scotland Street School Museum.

stations.name: West Street
stations.description: West Street station serves the Tradeston and Kingston areas of Glasgow. It is the least busy station on the network

stations.name: Bridge Street
stations.description: Bridge Street subway station serves Laurieston and Gorbals. It is the main interchange between the Glasgow Subway and buses travelling to and from the south side. It is the nearest subway station for the Citizens Theatre, O2 Academy Glasgow, Glasgow Sheriff Court and Glasgow Central Mosque.

stations.name: St. Enoch
stations.description: St. Enoch station is located north of the River Clyde in the city centre. Although it does not have direct interchange with the main line railway, it is located approximately halfway between Glasgow Central railway station and Argyle Street railway station, within a few minutes' walk to both.

stations.name: Buchanan Street
stations.description: Buchanan Street station serves the popular shopping street of the same name.  Interchange to Queen Street railway station is provided by a travelator.  This is the busiest station on the subway.

stations.name: Cowcaddens
stations.description: This station is on the North side of the city centre, serving the Cowcaddens area.

stations.name: St George's Cross
stations.description: This station serves the Woodside and Woodlands areas of the city.

stations.name: Kelvinbridge
stations.description: This station is named after the bridge crossing the River Kelvin, next to the station. This station is one of the two serving Kelvingrove Park.

stations.name: Hillhead
stations.description: The entrance to this station is located on Byres Road, a popular shopping destination. This station is the nearest to Glasgow Botanic Gardens and the University of Glasgow.

stations.name: Kelvinhall
stations.description: Kelvinhall is near to many of the city's best known tourist destinations including: The Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, Kelvingrove Park and The University of Glasgow.
